alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Fergus County below 4500ft; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Northern Blaine County; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 01 at 9:23PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Light snow to persist through at least midnight over North Central Montana... Snow, mostly light, will continue over the plains east of Interstate 15 through at least midnight, with light snow lingering after midnight. Additional snow accumulations should remain less than one inch, but it will be enough to cause some roads to become slick and snow-covered. Another surge of light snow will spread south along and just west of the Interstate 15 corridor through this evening, but accumulations there should remain less than one half inch. Overall, visibilities will fall below 3 miles at times, but some areas may have visibility reduced to less than one mile. A breezy northerly wind will also cause wind chills to fall below zero at times. For those traveling across the area tonight, remain alert for changing visibility and road conditions, and dress appropriately for the cold.
